about.aboutContent:
To start:

  1. Select the Hazard you would like to explore by clicking on the "Explore Your Hazard" button  located in the top left of the map screen. Click the box next to the hazard data you would like to view.
  2. Next, search for your desired target location by clicking on the "Choose Your Location" button 
    • Search by entering in the name of the county you wish to calculate impacts. The map will then zoom into your selected location.
  3. Finally, calculate the impacts on your community. There are two ways you can calculate the impacts.
    • If your county is now highlighted on the map. You may simply click within the county boundary, then click the three dots in the bottom left of the pop-up box. Now select:   Set Location
    • Or, if you would like to create your own location in which to calculate impacts: Click on the "Calculate Impacts" button  in the upper left, next to the "Choose Your Location" button. Now the Calculate Impacts widget will be open on the bottom of your screen. Next, you may draw your own location boundary. To do this, select the "Draw Point", "Draw Line", or "Draw Polygon" button in located on bottom left. Select a buffer if you would like to buffer your drawn point, line, or polygon. Then, just simply draw your desired location. (Double click to end the line or polygon)
Now the impacts of your location have been run. The results are in the bottom tabs.
